entries.title: Middle East Crisis: Israel Starts New Offensive in Central Gaza; Dozens Reported Dead
entries.description: Israel said it launched operations “above and below ground” against Hamas militants. The only hospital in the area is overwhelmed with wounded, medics say.

entries.title: Famine Looms in Sudan as Civil War Pushes Capital Toward Abyss
entries.description: A year of fighting has turned the once proud capital, Khartoum, into a charred battleground. Millions have fled. Now a famine threatens in one of Africa’s biggest countries.

entries.title: A Cease-Fire in Gaza Might Be the Easy Part. Fulfilling It Will Be Harder.
entries.description: The proposal backed by President Biden is deeply political and aims at stopping the war at least for now. But Israel rejects a permanent cease-fire and Hamas has its own reasons for reluctance.

entries.title: Rahul Gandhi, Long on the Ropes, Looks Set for an Unexpected Comeback
entries.description: The Indian National Congress and its leader registered a far stronger showing in India’s elections than many expected.

entries.title: Narendra Modi Fell to Earth After Making It All About Himself
entries.description: The Indian leader used his singular persona to lift his party to new heights. Then the opposition found a way to use his cult of personality against him.

entries.title: Israel Secretly Targets U.S. Lawmakers With Influence Campaign on Gaza War
entries.description: Israel’s Ministry of Diaspora Affairs ordered the operation, which used fake social media accounts urging U.S. lawmakers to fund Israel’s military, according to officials and documents about the effort.

entries.title: India’s 2024 Election Takeaways: Modi Struggles to Stay on Top
entries.description: The prime minister will keep his job, but his aura has been diminished and his leadership has fundamentally changed as the country’s multiparty democracy springs back to life.

entries.title: One Year of Civil War in Sudan: What We Know About the Conflict
entries.description: Fighting between the military and a powerful paramilitary group has led to massacres, caused millions to flee their homes and now threatens to cause a famine.

category.#text: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat

entries.title: As Ukraine’s Summer Starts With Blackouts, Worries Over Winter Begin
entries.description: Recent rolling power outages have raised alarm about what will happen when cold weather arrives and energy consumption goes even higher.

entries.title: Amanda Knox Convicted in Slander Retrial Over 2007 Killing
entries.description: The American, who spent several years in jail but was exonerated in 2015 of the killing of her housemate in Italy, was defending herself against a charge related to the case.

entries.title: The D-Day Battle France Chose to Forget. Until Now.
entries.description: Far from Normandy’s beaches, French paratroopers and resistance members fought a rear-guard action to keep the Nazis at bay. But its tragic end had made it a battle to forget.

entries.title: As Ukraine Rebuilds Its Identity, Folk Songs Are the New Cool
entries.description: Faced with Russia’s efforts to erase Ukrainian culture, people have embraced traditional music as a way to reconnect with their past and affirm their identity.

entries.title: U.S. Embassy in Beirut Targeted With Gunfire
entries.description: An attacker was wounded and arrested, the Lebanese Army said. An embassy security guard was injured.

entries.title: London Hospitals Face Major Disruptions After Cyberattack
entries.description: A system used by several major London hospitals was targeted in a ransomware cyberattack, forcing the cancellation of services and the diversion of patients.

entries.title: Pro Skier and Partner Fall to Their Deaths in the Italian Alps
entries.description: Jean Daniel Pession, a speed skier on the World Cup circuit, and his girlfriend, Elisa Arlian, fell more than 2,000 feet.

entries.title: What to Know About the Latest Gaza Cease-Fire Proposal
entries.description: Neither Israel or Hamas have said definitively whether they would accept or reject a proposal outlined by President Biden, but sizable gaps between the two sides appear to remain.

entries.title: Collectors Line Up in London as King Charles Bank Notes Are Released
entries.description: A steady stream of people lined up at the Bank of England on Wednesday to get what they hoped would be collector’s items: the first bank notes featuring the portrait of King Charles III.

category.#text: Charles III, King of the United Kingdom
Elizabeth II, Queen of Great Britain

entries.title: ‘Hanging by a Thread’: U.N. Chief Warns of Missing a Key Climate Target
entries.description: His comments came as the world body’s weather agency said it expected Earth to soon surpass the record high temperatures experienced in 2023.

entries.title: Allies Warn Former Fighter Pilots Not to Train Chinese Military Members
entries.description: A new bulletin says China is trying to step up recruitment of Western-trained fighter pilots to improve its air combat capability.

entries.title: The New Kingmakers Who Could Make or Break Modi’s Government
entries.description: Two veterans of bare-knuckled Indian politics have the Parliament votes the prime minister will need, but neither is aligned with his Hindu-first vision.

entries.title: Far-Right Politician Attacked With Box Cutter in Germany
entries.description: The authorities said the attack did not appear to be targeted. But it came days after members of an anti-Islam group were stabbed in the same city, raising fears about violence before E.U. elections.

entries.title: It’s Wedding Season: Here Come the Owls
entries.description: What better way to deliver the rings to the bride and groom?

entries.title: Wednesday Briefing
entries.description: Narendra Modi’s election setback in India.

entries.title: No Arrest in Prisoner Manhunt in France, Weeks After Deadly Ambush
entries.description: The aftermath of a brazen attack on a prison convoy has raised uncomfortable questions for France’s justice system.

entries.title: Rishi Sunak and Keir Starmer Clash in U.K. Election Debate
entries.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, fighting to narrow a substantial polling gap, adopted an aggressive approach against his Labour Party opponent, Keir Starmer.

entries.title: Rob Burrow, Rugby Star and A.L.S. Campaigner, Dies at 41
entries.description: The “Mighty Atom” enjoyed a glittering professional career in Britain before gaining more acclaim for his charity efforts after a diagnosis of motor neuron disease.

entries.title: Israel-Hamas Cease-Fire Plan Outlined by Biden Stirs Skepticism in Gaza
entries.description: A cease-fire plan described by President Biden has stirred cautious optimism after nearly eight months of war in the Gaza Strip.

entries.title: Wednesday Briefing: Modi’s Bruising Path to a Third Term
entries.description: Also, a Times analysis of the destruction in Ukraine.

category.#text: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

entries.title: House Votes to Impose Sanctions on I.C.C. Officials Over Israel Prosecution
entries.description: The Republican-written bill, which the White House strongly opposes, stands little chance of becoming law after lawmakers failed to reach a bipartisan deal on penalizing measures.

entries.title: Ukraine Strikes Into Russia With Western Weapons, Official Says
entries.description: The official said Ukraine had destroyed missile launchers in the Russian region of Belgorod using an American-made rocket system.

entries.title: Visiting Europe, Biden Will Find Both Solidarity and Isolation
entries.description: The president arrived in France for a visit meant to mark the 80th anniversary of the D-Day invasion and showcase Western unity. But even as he rallies American allies in defense of Ukraine, he will defy them on the war in Gaza.

entries.title: Modi Wins 3rd Term in India Election With Closer Results Than Expected
entries.description: Though Narendra Modi will take up a third term as India’s leader, the election was closer than expected, forcing him to rely on coalition partners that don’t share his Hindu nationalist agenda.

entries.title: India’s Next Government Will Face Serious Climate Challenges
entries.description: Farmers have repeatedly protested over grievances tied to global warming, a major political and economic test given the importance of India’s rural economy.

entries.title: Rwanda’s 2024 Election: What to Know
entries.description: President Paul Kagame led Rwanda out of the genocide, but has since dominated the country like a colossus. He is running for a fourth term after winning three elections.

entries.title: India’s Stock Market Tumbles on Close-Run Election Result
entries.description: A bull run came to an abrupt end when Narendra Modi’s party fell short of expectations.

entries.title: Early 2024 Election Results Suggest Turnaround for India’s Main Opposition Party
entries.description: India’s beleaguered main opposition party was on track to surpass expectations and nearly double its share of parliamentary seats from 2019.

entries.title: As Mexico Elects Claudia Sheinbaum, the Departing Leader Begins His Farewell
entries.description: President Andrés Manuel López Obrador, who has been a defining figure in Mexican politics, has said he will retire to a family ranch after his term ends. Some expect his influence will continue.

entries.title: Modi May Need Partners to Form India’s Next Government
entries.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is on track to secure a third term, but a dip in his party’s electoral support will have political consequences.

entries.title: How Modi Capitalized on India’s Economic Rise
entries.description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inherited a big and growing economy, kept it going and worked to put his imprint on every aspect of its success.

entries.title: Tuesday Briefing
entries.description: Mexico’s new president.

entries.title: Meet the Man Everyone Trusts on U.K. Election Nights: John Curtice
entries.description: Prof. John Curtice, a polling guru with a formidable intellect and an infectious smile, has contributed to Britain’s TV election coverage since 1979.

entries.title: Before a Debate, the U.K. Election Campaign Just Got Messier
entries.description: The surprise candidacy of Nigel Farage, a Trump ally and architect of Brexit, unsettled a stagnant campaign before a first TV debate Tuesday night.

entries.title: Netanyahu’s Far-Right Partners Reject Cease-Fire Compromise
entries.description: Two coalition members threatened to topple Israel’s government if Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu accepted a deal for a cease-fire and the release of hostages that stopped short of Hamas’s total destruction.

entries.title: Tuesday Briefing: Mexico Elects Its First Woman President
entries.description: Also, the U.S. is poised to change its asylum policy.

category.#text: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas

entries.title: Jacob Zuma Gets His Revenge on South African Party That Shunned Him
entries.description: A new party led by Mr. Zuma, a former president forced out over corruption allegations, helped ensure that the African National Congress fell short of an outright majority for the first time since the end of apartheid.

category.#text: Spear of the Nation (MK) (South African Political Party)

entries.title: Brazil’s Deadly Flooding Made Twice as Likely by Global Warming, Study Finds
entries.description: The country’s south received three months’ rain in two weeks. Global warming has made such deluges twice as likely as before, scientists said.

category.#text: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies

entries.title: Claudia Sheinbaum’s Morena Party Dominates Mexico’s Elections
entries.description: Expectations were high for the leftist Morena party, and it exceeded them, potentially giving President-elect Claudia Sheinbaum and her allies the power to enact systemic change.

entries.title: Israel Says 4 More Hostages Are Dead, Killed Months Ago in Gaza
entries.description: The disclosure by the military was likely to add pressure on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government to move forward with a cease-fire deal.

entries.title: Mexico Joins List of Latin American Nations That Have Elected Female Presidents
entries.description: In contrast to the United States, the region has had more than a dozen female leaders, many in democracies that were once under the sway of authoritarian governments.

entries.title: Floods Break Dams and Submerge Highways in Southern Germany
entries.description: Several towns declared states of emergency and evacuated citizens as water submerged streets and highways and derailed a high-speed train.

entries.title: Brexit Champion Nigel Farage Will Run in U.K. Election
entries.description: Nigel Farage, an anti-immigration campaigner and Trump ally, reversed a pledge not to run. His Reform U.K. party hopes to take seats from Conservatives.

entries.title: Intense Heat in Delhi Leaves Water in Short Supply
entries.description: A heat wave has left water in short supply across India’s capital region. The poorest are left to crowd around tankers to get whatever they can.

entries.title: In Myanmar, a New Threat for the Rohingya
entries.description: Allegations against the Arakan Army, a key force in the fight against the junta, threaten to revive old horrors of sectarian atrocities.

entries.title: Israel’s Seizure of Gaza Border Zone Strains Ties With Egypt
entries.description: Israel defied ominous Egyptian warnings and took control of the Philadelphi Corridor, but the reaction from Egypt, which wants to maintain its security cooperation with Israel, has been muted.

entries.title: What Are Eco-Friendly Ways to Control Backyard Bugs?
entries.description: Meet the “bucket of doom” and other methods to manage mosquitoes and ticks.

entries.title: Another Milestone in Mexico: Its First Jewish President
entries.description: Claudia Sheinbaum was born to Jewish parents, but she has played down her heritage on the campaign trail.

entries.title: In Former Soviet States, a Tug of War Between East and West
entries.description: Geopolitical rivalry, intensified by fighting in Ukraine, is amplifying domestic struggles in countries like Georgia and Moldova whose people are split on which side to support.

entries.title: Arrest Threatens Nepal’s Standing as Bastion of Free Speech
entries.description: A media executive was arrested after his company published critical reports about a powerful government minister.
